fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29489].
  {panel}

The 'user-list' macro currently list the the following pieces of information when used on a page.

* Username
* User display name
* Email Address

There are a number of other details which are stored in a users profile that would be helpful to have displayed when showing a list of users.  For example, any of the following could be added.

* Phone
* IM
* Website
* Postion
* Department
* Location

A list of these attributes with check box's to decide which to include when the 'user-list' macro is inserted would be excellent to see
fields.summary: Add Option(s) to Display Additional Details in 'user-list' macro From User Profiles

fields.description:
If you try to set some bullet points with some words inside a {{TOC macro}} on a confluence page and then try to export this page to a PDF somehow extra space is added inside the {{TOC macro}} and thus some content which would be less than half a page becomes about 3 pages of void content.

See screenshoot and PDF attached for example.
fields.summary: Bullet points inside a TOC macro and PDF export

fields.description:
On certain pages within Confluence, the top menu bar displays letters instead of numbers. This happens on the login page and on certain spaces. 

For myself, I have seen the behavior in IE 10, 9, and 8 but the behavior is not consistent across the 3 different browsers. 

I am not able to reproduce this in Chrome however.

We do run SSL for our confluence site and I have followed directions for setting up SSL from your page. I did not place the code in listed at the problem that speaks about the bug with IE downloading attachments as it seems attachments are downloaded fine.

Here is a link to others that seem to have the same problem. Turning off SSL is not an option for us since our page is externally accessible.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/159872/icons-on-confluence-menubar-are-replaced-by-letters-in-ie8-ie9
fields.summary: Top menu bar icons are displayed as numbers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29483].
  {panel}

When launching the following command to fire a REST call to keyboard shortcut plugin, it return an Internal server error due the validation failure: 

{code}
[root@test ~]# curl -I -X GET "https://confluence.atlassian.com/rest/prototype/1/i18n?locale=%3Cscript%20src%3Dhttp%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%2Fj%20&pluginKeys=com.atlassian.confluence.keyboardshortcuts&pluginKeys=com.atlassian.plugins.editor"
HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
Date: Tue, 28 May 2013 07:45:22 GMT
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=170C9ADB0247492D66B79F72E1B34A23; Path=/; HttpOnly
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Connection: close
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
{code}
fields.summary: URL validation failed for REST call to  the keyboard shortcut plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29482].
  {panel}

h3. Background of Request

The current behavior of Confluence is to hide both child pages list in the lower part of the page and child page tree in the side navigation bar of "Documentation Theme".

This behavior require user to click at least once to see the list of child pages  of the parent page accessed and due to the design of the new drop down button it is hard to differentiate pages that have children and the one that doesn't have child pages. Since opening up the whole child page list in the lower part of the page could be aesthetically unpleasing if the number of child pages is huge, we should provide the option for this at side bar navigation. 

h3. Proposed Solution

Since "Documentation Theme" provide side  navigation bar to, it would be great if administrator or users of Confluence has the ability to configure it to open the child page tree automatically when the parent page accessed.

Hence user will be able to use side navigation bar to see the list of child pages without clicking it.

For administrator, this configuration should be provided at theme configuration. For users, this configuration should be provided at user profile preferences option.

Another method is to improve the button icon to be a bigger and higher contrast so user would at least able to differentiate it easily.
fields.summary: Expand Child Pages Tree Automatically When Opening Parent Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29478].
  {panel}

h3. Background of Request

As of now, Confluence what's new feature can only be configurable to point to another Confluence page or link through modifying {{help.prefix}} as describe here:

* [Configuring the What's New Dialog|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+What's+New+Dialog]

However, help prefix also necessary when customer want to localized their help section as describe [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Local+Confluence+Documentation#LocalConfluenceDocumentation-helppagelinks]. This made the current method of What's New configuration unusable if customer want to use its own locale but keep the what's new to Atlassian site as describe [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-29065].

h3. Proposed Solution

It would be great if Confluence provide a user interface method for What's new feature that cover the following option:

* Follow {{help.prefix}}, and provide the field to input the prefix
* Follow Atlassian site. This means it will always follow Atlassian What's new link repository which check against its version
* Full Path URL. This provide the option to point to a specific URL
fields.summary: User Interface Configuration for What's New

fields.description:
Here is the steps to reproduce the problem: 
# Set up Confluence 4.3.5 with an empty space.
# Create a page with word macro to display a word attachment file (either doc or docx). For the word file, insert an image. 
# Shutdown Confluence then upgrade to 5.1.3. 
# Restart Confluence then open the same page.
# The image in the word file is not shown up on the page but with a broken windows.

It seems there is a bug in the new office connector plugin that cause the issue. 

As a possible workaround solution (not available for Ondemand instances): 
# Download the Confluence standalone kit [here|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-5.1.1.zip].
# Unzip the file to a temporary folder. 
# Pick up the file "OfficeConnector-3.0.2.jar" in the folder "/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins".
# Shutdown Confluence. 
# Navigate to the folder "<Confluence instance>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins"
# Move the file "OfficeConnector-3.0.3.jar" to other folder to make a backup and parse the file "OfficeConnector-3.0.2.jar".
# Remove the following directories:
#* <confluence-home>/bundled-plugins
#* <confluence-home>/plugin-cache
#* <confluence-home>/plugins-osgi-cache
#* <confluence-home>/plugins-temp
#* <confluence-home>/bundled-plugins_language
# Restart Confluence.
fields.summary: Image is not showing up in the word macro after upgrade to 5.1.3

fields.description:
In previous versions of Confluence, when you floated a panel to the right of a page and put an info box in the page, the width of the panel respected the floated panel, and would not overlap with it. In newer versions of Confluence, only the contents of the info panel do - the border still overlaps with floating elements. I have attached a screenshot to indicate what I mean.

STR:
# Create a page and in it put a panel at the top with loremipsum.
# Underneath put some loremipsum.
# Underneath that put an info panel and put some loremimpsum in that. Save the page.
# In the developer view of your browser, target the div for the first panel and assign it {float: right; width: 20%}. It will now float to the right of the page. 

Note that the loremipsum in the body of the page does not overlap with the panel, but the info box does. This is incorrect behaviour.

EDIT
Despite spending some time looking at it yesterday I have just figured out how to workaround it. You should set {overflow: auto} to .aui-message. This is a bit of a CSS hack, tbh, but it works.
fields.summary: Info / tip / warning / note (.aui-message) panels does not respect floating elements

Hi,

We have Jira, Confluence, Crowd, Bamboo, Fisheye all running behind a reverse proxy (apache httpd). We would like to log the currently authenticated user in the logs of apache, instead of having 5 different tomcat valve logs with that information.

Would you please add this information in a response header - obviously, for simplicity, the same header name across all Atlassian apps would be welcome.

Thank you
--
Issa

	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.DefaultJiraIssuesManager$1.handle(DefaultJiraIssuesManager.java:112){noformat}

Steps to reproduce:
# Set up JIRA and Confluence on Trusted application
# Set up a Crowd instance connecting to JIRA and Confluence.
# The username for the user in Confluence is abc@abc.com
# In Crowd, create an alias for this user for JIRA as 'test'
# So, the username for the same user in JIRA is test
# Now login to JIRA with this user and then create an issue.
# In Confluence, create a page with JIRA issues macro and insert a link to the issue created above in JIRA.
# The error message above should show up..

JIRA issues macro is not able to translate the user 'test' to 'abc@abc.com'

You can also find more information in [JIRA issues macro displays "USER_UNKNOWN"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=365003703].

fields.description:
h5. Symptoms

When copying two pages at the same time, by the same user, if one of them has an attachment, and you save in the reverse order to the "Copy" operation being triggered, then the attachment will be saved in the wrong copy. This does not happen if two copy operations are being done by different users. It does happen when the same user is doing both copies, even if the same user is performing the copies from two different sessions to Confluence.

Any links to the attachment will point to the location where the attachment ends up, so will still work.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page, which we will refer to as "Page One"
# Attach a file to Page One
# Create a page, which we will refer to as "Page Two"
# Open Page One and Page Two in two different tabs
# Click "Tools > Copy" in Page One, do not save yet
# Click "Tools > Copy" in Page Two
# Click "save" in Page Two
# Click "save" in Page One

After these steps you will find the attachment originally from Page One has been attached to "Copy of Page Two", with "Copy of Page One" not having any attachment.

h5. Workaround

Since this only happens when it's the same user doing the copy, it's possible to work around this by only saving in a first-in first-out method. That is, all pages should be saved in the order in which the Copy operation was triggered.
fields.summary: When two pages are copied at the same time by the same user where one has an attachment, the attachment appears on the wrong copy

fields.description:
When you have a confluence set with a LDAP user directory, Confluence assumes that the memberof group attribute is always filled for the user in the LDAP structure.

So if a user in the tree doesn't have this attribute filled, confluence will fail to map the rest of that specific user groups memberships and will throw this error:
{code}
WARN [http-8080-18] [directory.ldap.mapper.UserContextMapper] mapFromContext Failed to map attribute <memberOf> from context with DN <uid=****,ou=****,
dc=***,dc=**>
org.springframework.ldap.BadLdapGrammarException: Failed to parse DN; nested exception is org.springframework.ldap.core.TokenMgrError: Lexical error at line 1, column 3. Encounte
red: "g" (103), after : " "
{code}

Workaround:
Ensure that the user has the attribute filled in the LDAP tree OR remove him from being synced by adding a filter to the LDAP user directory in confluence.
fields.summary: Confluence should handle the missing memberof attribute message
Remember Sidebar Collapse Beyond Browser Session

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29390].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add a code block to it with the theme Fade to Grey
#- Preview the page and observe that the code block is a black background with white text
# Add another code block, and do not set a theme on it
#- Preview again and observe that both code blocks have the default formatting

_______________________________
Hi,
We've experienced recently some problems with Code Block Macro. Those problems unfortunately started to repeat.

Those are the steps that I've done:
1. Wrote "Logback configuration" section with code block (formatting in attachment).
2. Save the document.
3. Edit and add upper section with another code block (different formatting) + some No Format block (I'm not sure if it's connected, but I think it's worth mention)
4. Save

Now all code blocks (as you can see in attachment) have the same formatting as last code block. I'm also not 100% sure if this formatting is inherited from last code block or just randomly.

I hope it's reproducible and can be fixed easily.

Confluence: 5.1
Code Macro Plugin:	2.0.19

Let me know if you need anythnig else.
fields.summary: Wrong Code Block Macro formatting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29388].
  {panel}

We use JIRA and confluence for a variety of purposes, most significantly as a requirements management tools and as an Application Portfolio Management Tools.

The specific use case is
We use JIRA as out application inventory capturing certain information about our application strategy etc, as well as assessment information. The information stored here is extracted into an excel spreadsheet that is attached to a wiki page. The charts generated by the spreadsheet are rendered on the page, as well as links to product documentation (stored in the wiki).

We would like to be able to display all of the detail of the issue in jira embedded in the page to provide a complete snapshot of the application (including linkages to related projects - we also keep our overall work queue in JIRA)

Another use case is to surface complete project summary information from a JIRA into the page

The only what I have found to do it is a HTML include, but it presents terribly and require anonymous access
fields.summary: Ability to display whole of jira issues in a confluence page

fields.description:
After upgrading to 4.3.7 we are experiencing issues similar to below:
( Please note this is very undesired behavior and we have many users reporting this issue. This is undermining the relevance of any messages received by confluence. Users are now setting up rules in their email boxes to filter and delete these types of messages, instead of paying attention to them as they used to )

3K of users are receiving Email notifications for pages even though the below conditions are met:

1, *all email notifications disabled in email settings on wiki*
2, not watching the page I am being notified about
3, did not create this page
4, did not modify this page
5, Subject is irrelevant to the content of the message ( page in the body of the email is not even in the same space as the page described in the subject line of the email)

Example (one of many)
Below email is created as a notification for a page created in space 'Mobile' by user A. Subject Line is related to Space 'Customer Service' that user B has created earlier that day. They have nothing in common.
 {code}
From: Panagiotis K (Confluence)
Sent: Wednesday, May 22, 2013 5:16 PM
To: Maria S
Subject: [confluence] Customer Service > HTML Header Footer > HTML Emails - experiment with footer
 
Panagiotis Karageorgakis created a page: 
Android Side Menu 
 {code}

Please advice how to fix this issue.
fields.summary: Buggy email notifications in Atlassian Confluence 4.3.7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29365].
  {panel}

As I suppose most customers do, we currently use Jira for the development team only, we then use confluence to publish our release notes for anonymous customers to view.  Currently we copy the notes out of Jira, and paste them into confluence manually.  As you can imagine, with constant changes in Jira this is difficult to maintain.

I was looking into the macro feature in confluence as described in:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro#JIRAIssuesMacro-restrictedviewing

The problem we have is that our customers do not have access to Jira, so I noticed the section: “Displaying Issues which have Restricted Viewing (Not applicable to Confluence OnDemand.)”.  The page does not mention a solution for OnDemand customers like us.

After contacting the atlassian support team, I was advised there's currently no easier way to achieve what we're trying to do, and to raise this new feature request.
fields.summary: Ability to publish JIRA issues for release notes as static text (not as a macro) for those who don't have access to JIRA

fields.description:
Up until April 25th some page content was shown within email notifications. These are the notifications sent when there has been a change on a certain page that the receiver of the notification is following. 

Sincs April 25th there is no content shown. Just the message "The space admin has restricted the display of removed page content." 

As Confluence administrator I have searched for settings to change this back.  The only thing I have found is: [space admin] --> [email notifications] --> enable all display settings. 
Even after enabling all the display settings, notifications do not show any content. This functionality does not seem to work or do anything.

I hope you can help me. 


note: We use version 4.2.12, but this is not included in the "Affects Version/s" picklist.
fields.summary: No page content in email notifications since April 25th
